title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1102.6 - Nonqualifying experience
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1102.6 - Nonqualifying experience

State Regulations

An applicant shall not receive experience credit for
residential certification or for general certification for performing any of
the following activities: (a) market
value estimates performed by a real estate licensee where such estimates are
made in connection with the listing and/or sale of real estate. Market value
estimates shall include estimates commonly known as comparative market
analysis; (b) [Reserved]
(c) business appraisals. However, an
applicant shall receive credit for appraisals of individual parcels of real
estate; (d) personal property
appraisals; and
(e) feasibility or
market analysis, except to the extent that the market value of a real estate
project is being estimated. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 19
ยง
1102.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
